Summary: White light flying across early morning sky.
divs: Sighting DetailsI always lay on the bed petting my cats while I look out the window. In fact, it is always at the same time....right around 6:40am during my work week. ,The view is phenomenal as I can see a wide area of the Naugatuck Valley and beyond. The morning light was just starting to appear from the west but to the east there was still a hint of darkness. No direct sunlight over the horizon yet. I am always searching the skies for planes etc and my eye caught sight of a white light coming from the SW, heading SE. I kept my eye on it knowing that it is very unusual to see a plane at that time. I got my binoculars to get a closer look. It appeared to be a solid white light, quite bright, in fact. I saw absolutely no red lights, no blinking lights, just a solid white light. I am not very good at estimating distance from the ground. This is what I know however. I watch a lot of planes flying. My house is located under the landing pattern where jets are flying into BDL so they are flying lower than 35,000 feet and I am used to seeing them at that height. So I am amateurishly estimating that this object flew between 10,000-20,000 feet. I tracked the object until it came close to the west and I lost it completely in the morning light. Speed of object.....it wasn't flying fast like a jet.... slower. I can only describe what I saw.....but it wasn't a plane.....it couldn't have been a satellite as it was low on the horizon and usually satellites are pinhead small in the sky. This object was a big, glowing white light. Thank you.
